newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani cotton rates close steady after budget.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani cotton rates close steady after budget.

text.p: Pakistani cotton rates closed steady on Saturday, a day after the 1997/98 (July-June) budget, which retained 10 percent sales tax on cotton, dealers at the private Karachi Cotton Association (KCA) said.
The tax is applicable to local sales but refundable on cotton exports, one dealer said.
Rates were likely to open at same levels on Monday, he said. In the kerb market, NIAB-78 variety was quoted at 2,125/2,250 rupees per maund (37.32 kg), K-68 at 2,425/2,450 and MNH-93 at 2,425/2,450.

The KCA said exporters had shipped 74,224 375-lb bales of cotton by May 28 compared to 1.81 million at the same time a year ago. Exporters had registered contracts for the export of 110,304 bales by June 11 compared to 2.32 million a year ago.
